intro: Leaoa hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran leaoa, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
